title: ry0t
author: ry0t
content: Hi, Yesterday I tried to invest using a limit order through pancakeswap here: https://pancakeswap.finance/limit-ordersIt was for EPX and the limit was for 0.001996 and I was going to invest $1000. While the transaction went into open state, the EPX token fell from 0.002100 to 0.001900 and down to 0.001800. The order did not actually go through even though the token price fell down to 0.001800. Do you know why the limit order did not go through? I had to cancel the order.Â  Did it have to specifically buy at 0.001996 or it wouldn't go through? That's the only thing I can think of. On any central exchange when the token price falls the order would be filled you know how that works right? So I don't understand why the limit order on pancakeswap stayed open and did not get filled. Plus there is no support and I don't know where to ask other than here or quora.

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: Do you have a link to the order?I'm wondering if you made the limit in the right direction but that's the main thing I can think of as of now (as it says you have to set an amount as token1 per token2).

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: There is a reason why your order was not executed, though it's hard to tell what exactly happenedThis article could be helpful to you - https://docs.pancakeswap.finance/products/pancakeswap-exchange/limit-orders/limit-orders-faqPancakeswap does not have customer support, buthttps://twitter.com/pancakeswaphttps://discord.gg/pancakeswaphttp://t.me/pancakeswap you can reach out their official communities in different social media platforms
